page.title: 16FAUNA OF HARNHILL MANOR FARM
page.content:
BIRDS 92 species have been recorded. These include of special interest. Bittern 1972, single winter visitor. Quail 1970, a pair nested and bred. Water Rail, a pair breed every year. Corncrake,1974, a single bird in Kale. Golden Plover, flocks arrive in Autumn Hobby 1969,taking insects over a hedge Buzzard, occasional winter visitor Geese, Canada, Greylag,Barnacle, and Whitefront. Short Eared Owl 1980, stayed 3 weeks. Woodpeckers, all 3 species regular. Nuthatch, nested 1979,1980,81 and 84. Marsh Tit, breeds most years. Kingfisher, seen nearly every winter.
MAMMALS 18 species have been recorded, Foxes and Badgers are common and breed on the farm nearly every year. Fallow Deer occasional.
